result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Stock Price under MM Proposition I** Consider two firms, **Leverage** and **NonLeverage**, that have identical assets and generate identical cash flows. NonLeverage is an all-equity firm with 1.93 million shares outstanding trading at 22.74 per share. Leverage has 2 million shares outstanding and 26 million in debt, with an interest rate of 5%. Under **Modigliani–Miller Proposition I (no taxes)**, compute the **stock price for Leverage (in $)**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ By MM I (no taxes): firm value unchanged. Equity value = Total assets − Debt = 43.89 − 26 = 17.89; Stock price = 17.89 ÷ 2 = 8.94.
::: :::
